column4: when i "apt-get upgrade" on my ubuntu11 it tries to install packages i dont even have installed instead of jus upgrading the ones i have. what should i do to upgrade just the packages i really hav?
hello how to make "apt-get upgrade" to only upgrade packages i realy have and dont install other packages?
what kinds of 'other packages' is it trying to install?
its trying to install samba, cups and many other
those are all packages you already have installed as part of the base ubuntu install
i already have removed them
and it stills try to install, how o workaround it?
right, the metapackage 'ubuntu-desktop' is probably trying to pull them in again
solution is to apt-get remove ubuntu-desktop
though i have no idea why you would want to remove samba and cups
i dont have printer nor share files
it didnt worked, same thing
sill trying to install those packages
bcuz i dont need it
sounds like premature optimisation to me, you aren't exaclty going to save scads of RAM or anything by uninstalling a few daemons
ok thx anyway
Click on networking icon, "Connection Settings", go into the settings for your WLAN connection, check the box "make this connection available to all users" and "connect automatically"
will try that
ty it worked
sweet, that's three problems solved tonight
if you can't get used to unity, you can always revert o 'ubuntu classic' at login
yeah i know
im just giving it a try
